name: Oliver Baez Bendorf
bio: Oliver Baez Bendorf is the author of Advantages of Being Evergreen (Cleveland State University Poetry Center, 2019) and The Spectral Wilderness (Kent State University Press, 2014). He earned a BA in English Literature from the University of Iowa, and an MFA in Poetry and MA in Library & Information from University of Wisconsin-Madison. He is a fellow of the CantoMundo Poetry Workshop, recipient of the Rane Arroyo Chapbook Prize, and was a faculty member at the 2019 Conference on Poetry at The Frost Place. He is an assistant professor of creative writing at Kalamazoo College in Michigan.
